intro: Elleanthus hoppii, commonly known as the Hoppi's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy white seed heads, aiding in wind pollination. Elleanthus hoppii is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
